result.title: 1. Cybersecurity Essentials for the Digital World
result.details: This lecture covers fundamental cybersecurity principles, common threats, and practical strategies to protect digital assets.
result.target: IT professionals, students, and small business owners
result.content: [{"id":1,"title":"Fundamentals of Cloud Computing","content":"Cloud computing delivers on-demand computing resources via the internet. It features scalability, elasticity, and resource pooling and is categorized into IaaS, PaaS, and SaaS.","activityGuides":[{"id":"1-1","activityGuide":"ice breaking"}],"presentationGuides":[{"id":"1-1","presentationGuide":"Key Points: Define cloud computing, highlight its characteristics (on-demand, scalable, cost-efficient), and explain service models (IaaS, PaaS, SaaS).\nVisuals: Diagram comparing traditional IT vs. cloud computing, icons representing IaaS, PaaS, SaaS with examples (e.g., AWS EC2, Google App Engine, Microsoft Office 365)."}]}]
